Recently, a former student said to me that some Western universities do not understand the system of 'University within a University' at some top universities in China. This creates disparity for Chinese international students in the West. Some students from tier-3 level colleges were admitted into the top universities in the West because their degrees carry the name of a top university but have limited relation with the university at all. At the same time, this also means that these Western universities thought they enrolled the students from the top universities but they did not. This prompted me to think about writing this blog to introduce the well-quoted '985 Project', '211 Project' and ' Double first-class initiative' of Chinese universities. I hope it helps some colleagues in the admissions team and partnership development of the UK and other Western universities, but also useful for colleagues who are into rankings. Prof. Shi acknowledged the existing limitations and obstacles in university collaborations but remained hopeful, advocating for constructive dialogues driven by thoughtful leaders and globalization. In navigating the complexities of the modern world, Prof. Shi envisioned a future where nations would cooperate to overcome obstacles, recognizing the interconnected nature of global issues. He believed that universities, the hub for delivering universal knowledge, could collectively contribute to finding solutions by fostering an environment conducive to constructive conversations.
